      • skin

        public skin()

    • Method Detail

      • CreateSkin

        public static ISkin CreateSkin(java.lang.String id,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.Object dep)
        Creates a new Skin in the Skins Directory, and activates it.
        Parameters:
        id - skin id, something like, "glassyicons", or "sls.skin1", etc
        name - friendly name
        dep - skin dependency
        Returns:
        null if the skin cannel be created, or if it already exists.

      • DeleteSkin

        public static void DeleteSkin(java.lang.Object skin)
        Completely removes a skin from the filesystem. Use with care. There is no undelete.
        Parameters:
        skin -

      • GetSkins

        public static ISkin[] GetSkins()
        Returns the available skins
        Returns:

      • StartSkin

        public static boolean StartSkin(ISkin plugin)
        Starts/Activates a skin. NOTE, this is NOT loading the skin into the current UI context, this simply resolves the skin and activates it, so that it can be loaded into the current UI context, using the LoadSkin() call.
        Parameters:
        plugin -
        Returns:
        if the skin can be activated

      • StopSkin

        public static boolean StopSkin(ISkin plugin)
        Stops a skin. ie, prevents it from being loaded using the LoadSkin() call.
        Parameters:
        plugin -
        Returns:

      • GetSkinResource

        public static java.io.File GetSkinResource(java.lang.Object skin,
                                           java.lang.String path)
        Return a skin resource by looking for it the plugin's path or by searching it's dependencies, if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        plugin -
        path -
        Returns:

      • FindSkin

        public static ISkin FindSkin(java.lang.Object skin)
        Finds a skin by Id
        Parameters:
        skin -
        Returns:
        Skin skin instance

      • GetSkin

        public static ISkin GetSkin(java.lang.Object skin)
        accepts a ISkin instance or a Skin Id

        throws a runtime exception if you give it an invalid skin

        Parameters:
        skin -
        Returns:

      • LoadSkin

        public static void LoadSkin(java.lang.String uiContext,
                            java.lang.Object skin)
        Load a skin into the current context. This will process the skin and it's image register and setup the global context for the given skin. If the Skin is not found or is not activated, then the default skin will be loaded.
        Parameters:
        uiContext - ui context for the skin
        skin - skin id or Skin skin instance
